src:
V vaseh skoraj vsi projekti, v mestu četrtina
06 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Veronika Rupnik Ženko

Postojnski občani so v okviru participatornega proračuna Moja občina v nedeljo izglasovali 28 projektov, skupno vrednih blizu 200.000 evrov, ki jih bo občina uvrstila v proračuna za leti 2020 in 2021. Na glasovanje je šlo 53 od skupno 122 predlogov občanov. Največ jih je izviselo v mestu. Udeležba je bila šestodstotna.



Med projekti, ki so v mestu dobili največ glasov, je tudi ureditev strnjene kolesarske poti po gozdnih poteh okoli Soviča. Foto: Veronika Rupnik Ženko

POSTOJNA > V proračuna za leti 2020 in 2021 so se prebili projekti, ki so na posameznem od štirih območij prejeli največje število glasov, in sicer po vrstnem redu do zapolnitve kvote denarja, ki za območje Postojne znaša 65.000 evrov, za ostala tri (Prestranek, Hruševje ter Studeno in Planina) pa po 45.000 evrov. V katerem letu se bodo izvedli, bodo odločile strokovne službe.
Na območju Postojne, ki je obsegalo mesto Postojna ter Staro vas, Veliki Otok in Zagon, se bo izmed 28 projektov, ki so se uvrstili na glasovanje, izvedlo devet, od tega šest (od 24) iz mesta in po trije (od štirih) iz ostalih treh vasi. Za slednje je bilo že vnaprej skoraj gotovo, da bodo izglasovani, saj je moral vsak občan nujno glasovati za tri predloge iz treh različnih naselij. Prav predlogi iz vasi so zato tudi prejeli skupno največje število glasov, medtem ko so se pri predlogih iz mesta glasovi bolj razpršili. Čeprav so meščani predlagali največ projektov, jih bo v mestu največ ostalo neuresničenih.
238glasov oziroma največ od vseh je dobil projekt osvetlitve igrišča v Zagonu
Na območju Postojne so največ glasov dobile osvetlitev igrišča v Zagonu, ureditev javnih stranišč v Velikem Otoku in razširitev vaške ceste v Stari vasi, medtem ko so v mestu največ glasov prejele postavitev hišk za prostoživeče mačke, sklenjene kolesarske poti po gozdnih poteh okoli Soviča in zasaditev dreves za prihodnost.
Na območju Hruševja bo izvedenih šest od devetih projektov, na območju Prestranka sedem od osmih ter na območju Planine in Studenega šest od osmih, ki so se uvrstili na glasovanje. Na teh območij so največ glasov prejeli obnova dveh vodnjakov na Velikih Brdih, ureditev makadamske gozdne kolesarske poti Grobišče in ureditev podpornega zidu v Gorenjah.
Direktorica občinske uprave in vodja delovne skupine za participatorni proračun Marina Rebec je ocenila, da so občani podali pametne predloge, ki kažejo na njihove želje in potrebe, kar bo usmeritev za občino tudi sicer pri oblikovanju proračuna. Prav tako bo po njenih besedah delovna skupina pilotno izvajanje participatornega proračuna analizirala in podala predloge izboljšav modela, verjento pa tudi za povišanje denarja za ta namen, kar bi občane v bodoče v še večji meri spodbudilo k dajanju predlogov in glasovanju. Zdaj namreč v nekaterih vaseh predlogov sploh niso dali, niti se niso udeležili glasovanja.
Glede udeležbe pa direktorica pravi, da so glasovanje omogočili na kar 24 lokacijah, tako kot pri volitvah, s čimer so želeli privabiti čim več ljudi. Prav tako so veliko pozornosti namenili informiranju, a je bila udeležba kljub temu le šestodstotna, medtem ko je povprečje v drugih občinah okrog deset odstotkov.
text:
In the villages almost all projects, in the city a quarter
06 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Veronika Rupnik Female

On Sunday, Postojna residents voted for 28 projects totaling close to € 200,000 under the My Municipality participatory budget, which the municipality will include in the 2020 and 2021 budgets. 53 of the 122 citizens' proposals went to vote. Most of them came out in the city. Attendance was six percent.



Among the projects that received the most votes in the city is the arrangement of a shortened cycle path along the forest trails around Sovič. Photo: Veronika Rupnik Female

POSTOJNA> Projects that received the highest number of votes in each of the four territories, in the order of filling the quota of 65,000 Euros for the Postojna region, for the other three (Prestranek, Hruševje and Studeno and Planina), and 45,000 euros each. In which year they will be performed, professional services will decide.
In the Postojna area, comprising Postojna and Staro vas, Veliki Otok and Zagon, nine of the 28 eligible projects will be implemented, of which six (out of 24) from the city and three each (out of four). from the other three villages. For the latter, it was almost certain in advance that they would be voted in, as each citizen was urgently required to vote for three proposals from three different settlements. It was precisely the proposals from the village that also received the largest number of votes, while the proposals from the town became more dispersed. Although the townspeople proposed the most projects, the majority will remain unfulfilled in the city.
238 votes, or most of them, were awarded to the project of lighting the playground in Zagon
Most of the Postojna area voted for lighting the playground in Zagon, arranging public toilets in the Big Island and widening the village road in Stari vas, while the town received the most votes for setting up houses for wild cats, cycling trails along forest trails around Sovič and planting trees for the future.
Six of the nine projects will be implemented in the Hruševje area, seven of the eight in Prestranka, and six of the eight eligible to vote in the Planina and Studen area. The restoration of two wells in Velika Brda, the construction of a gravelly macadam forest bike trail and the construction of a retaining wall in Gorenje received the most votes in these areas.
The director of the municipal administration and the head of the working group on participatory budgeting, Marina Rebec, estimated that the citizens had made smart proposals that indicated their wishes and needs, which will be a focus for the municipality even when formulating the budget. She also said that the working group will analyze the pilot implementation of the participatory budget and make proposals for improvements to the model, as well as to raise money for this purpose, which would further encourage citizens to submit proposals and vote in the future. Now, in some villages, they have not even put forward any proposals, nor did they vote.
Regarding participation, the director says that they made voting possible in as many as 24 locations, as they did in the elections, in order to attract as many people as possible. They also paid much attention to information, but participation was still only six percent, while the average in other municipalities was around ten percent.
